page.title: 06Population of Dean
page.content: At the last census in 1981, the population of Dean with Shelton was 317 in 110 households. This was made up of 69 people under 16 years of age and 48 of pensionable age (for males over 65 and females over 60) Only 17 households were without a car. There is only 1 household in Lower Dean whose residents have always lived in Dean, whereas there are several families in Upper Dean who have always lived in the village. There is now quite a large percentage of the population, especially in Lower Dean, who have moved here from other parts of the country and who will probably move on with their work.
